intro: Tithymalus haussknechtii, commonly known as the Haussknecht's tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
